RevisionEvent.Note: Updated to SPASE Version 2.3.2 if needed, Applied quality control for DOI usage, LFB

ResourceHeader.Description: Hourly averaged, multi-source, near-Earth solar wind magnetic field, plasma and energetic proton flux data, plus AE, AU, AL, Kp, ap, and Dst geomagnetic indices, Polar Cap (Thule) index, F10.7 index, and Rz (sunspot number). Also available at 1-day and 27-day resolution.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: We acknowledge the experiment teams that acquired, processed and provided the OMNI-included data, and J.H. King and N.E. Papitashvili of NASA/GSFC for creating the OMNI data set.

PublicationInfo.Authors: Papitashvili, Natalia E.; & King, Joseph H.

AccessURL.Name: FTP access to CDFs at SPDF
AccessURL.Description: ftp access to annual ASCII files of 1-hour OMNI data and to one full-time-span file for each 1-day and 27-day averages.

AccessURL.Name: HTTP access to CDFs at SPDF
AccessURL.Description: In CDF via HTTP from SPDF

AccessURL.Name: FTPS from SPDF (not with most browsers)
AccessURL.Description: In CDF via HTTP from SPDF

AccessURL.Name: HTTPS from SPDF
AccessURL.Description: In CDF via HTTP from SPDF

AccessURL.Name: OMNIWeb
AccessURL.Description: Pathway to data and to extensive documentation. Plots, listings and user-specified files. Scatter plots and linear regressions. Distributions. Means, medians, standard deviations in distributions. Pathway to 1-min, 5-min, 1-day, 27-day averages.

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: We acknowledge the experiment teams that acquired, processed and provided the OMNI-included data, and J.H. King and N.E. Papitashvili of NASA/GSFC for creating the OMNI data set.

AccessURL.Name: CDAWeb HAPI Server
AccessURL.Description: Web Service to this product using the HAPI interface.

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: We acknowledge the experiment teams that acquired, processed and provided the OMNI-included data, and J.H. King and N.E. Papitashvili of NASA/GSFC for creating the OMNI data set.

TimeSpan.Note: Various parameters are held current to differing levels. Typical delay is about 1-2 months.

Parameter.Name: Year
Parameter.Description: Year.

Parameter.Name: Doy
Parameter.Description: Decimal day of year (Jan 1 = Day 1).

Parameter.Name: Hour
Parameter.Description: Decimal hour of day (0, 1, ...23; the average for hour 1 is from 01:00 to 02:00).

Parameter.Name: BRN
Parameter.Description: Bartel's rotation number

Parameter.Description:
ID for magnetic field data source spacecraft for this hour. See documentation cited above.

Parameter.Name: IMF FTS PTS
Parameter.Description: Number of fine scale points in magnetic field parameter averages for this hour

Parameter.Name: Plasma FTS PTS
Parameter.Description: Number of fine scale points in plasma parameter averages for this hour

Parameter.Name: Average magnetic field magnitude
Parameter.Description: Average of fine scale field magnitudes

Parameter.Name: Magnitude of average magnetic field vector
Parameter.Description: Magnitude of vector-averaged magnetic field vector. SQRT(<Bx>**2 + <By>**2 +<Bz>**2)

Parameter.Name: Elevation angle of average magnetic field vector
Parameter.Description: Elevation angle of vector-averaged magnetic field vector. ARCTAN <Bz>/SQRT(<Bx>**2 + <By>**2)

Parameter.Name: Azimuthal angle of average magnetic field vector
Parameter.Description: Azimuthal angle of vector-averaged magnetic field vector. ARCTAN <By>/<Bx>

Parameter.Name: Magnetic field vector, GSE
Parameter.Description: Averaged GSE Cartesian components of magnetic field vector

Structure.Description: Three hourly averaged magnetic field Cartesian components, in GSE

Parameter.Name: Magnetic field vector, GSM
Parameter.Description: Averaged GSM Cartesian components of magnetic field vector
Parameter.Caveats: Note that Bx(GSM)=Bx(GSE) is given only once in data record.

Structure.Description: Three hourly averaged magnetic field Cartesian components, in GSE

Parameter.Name: Standard deviation in average magnetic field magnitude
Parameter.Description: Standard derviation in average of fine scale field magnitudes

Parameter.Name: Standard deviation of average magnetic field vector
Parameter.Description: Standard deviation of vector-averaged magnetic field vector. SQRT(sigma<Bx>**2 + sigma<By>**2 + Sigma<Bz>**2)

Parameter.Name: Standard deviations in GSE component averages
Parameter.Description: Standard deviations in averaged GSE Cartesian components of magnetic field vector

Structure.Description: Three standard deviations in hourly averaged GSE magnetic field Cartesian components

Parameter.Name: Plasma proton temperature
Parameter.Description: Plasma proton temperature, variously derived for various OMNI-input data sets. Cross normalized

Parameter.Name: Plasma proton density
Parameter.Description: Plasma proton density, variously derived for various OMNI-input data sets. Cross normalized

Parameter.Name: Plasma proton flow speed
Parameter.Description: Plasma proton flow speed, variously derived for various OMNI-input data sets. Cross normalized

Parameter.Name: Flow azimuth angle
Parameter.Description: Angle from negative Xgse axis towards positive Ygse axis

Parameter.Name: Flow elevation angle
Parameter.Description: Angle (lease angle) from GSE X-Y plane to flow vector

Parameter.Name: Alpha to proton density ratio
Parameter.Description: Alpha to proton density ratio

Parameter.Name: Flow pressure
Parameter.Description: Flow pressure. P (nPa) = (1.67/10**6) * Np*V**2 * (1+ 4*Na/Np) Created from hourly averaged Np, Na, V

Parameter.Name: Plasma parameter standard deviations
Parameter.Description: An array of 6 standard deviations in the hourly averages of temperature, density, flow speed, two flow direction angles and the Na/Np ratio
Parameter.Caveats: The units of the standard deviations match the units of the parent parameters.

Structure.Description: An array of 6 standard deviations in the hourly averages of temperature, density, flow speed, two flow direction angles and the Na/Np ratio

Parameter.Name: VxB Electric Field
Parameter.Description: VxB electric field. -V(km/s) * Bz (nT; GSM) * 10**-3 Hourly averaged V and Bz used, the product is nearly the Ey component.

Parameter.Name: Alfven Mach Number
Parameter.Description: Alfven Mach number (V * Np**0.5) / 20 * B

Parameter.Name: Kp Index
Parameter.Description: Kp index, but rather than standard 3-,3,3+, we use 27,30,33, etc.

Parameter.Name: Sunspot Number
Parameter.Description: Daily sunspot number

Parameter.Name: Dst Index
Parameter.Description: Dst Index
Parameter.Caveats: Note that quick look values are given for most recent times, to be replaced by preliminary values as they become available, in turn to be replaced by definitive values as they become available

Parameter.Name: AE Index
Parameter.Description: AE Index
Parameter.Caveats: Note that quick look values are given for most recent times, to be replaced by preliminary values as they become available, in turn to be replaced by definitive values as they become available

Parameter.Name: Energetic Proton Fluxes
Parameter.Description: Hourly fluxes of protons above 1, 2, 4, 10, 30, 60 MeV; 1967-near current; 1973-2005 from IMP 8 CPME; 2006 and later from GOES

Structure.Description: One flux for each of the 6 energy thresholds

Parameter.Name: ap Index
Parameter.Description: ap index

Parameter.Name: F10.7 Index
Parameter.Description: F10.7 solar index

Parameter.Name: Polar Cap (N) Index
Parameter.Description: Polar Cap Index based on Thule

Parameter.Name: AL Index
Parameter.Description: AL Index
Parameter.Caveats: Note that quick look values are given for most recent times, to be replaced by preliminary values as they become available, in turn to be replaced by definitive values as they become available

Parameter.Name: AU Index
Parameter.Description: AU Index
Parameter.Caveats: Note that quick look values are given for most recent times, to be replaced by preliminary values as they become available, in turn to be replaced by definitive values as they become available
